question.title: Surface Area of 3D Shapes
question.content:
You are given an n x n grid where you have placed some 1 x 1 x 1 cubes. Each value v = grid[i][j] represents a tower of v cubes placed on top of cell (i, j).

After placing these cubes, you have decided to glue any directly adjacent cubes to each other, forming several irregular 3D shapes.

Return the total surface area of the resulting shapes.

Note: The bottom face of each shape counts toward its surface area.

 

Example 1:

Input: grid = [[1,2],[3,4]]
Output: 34

Example 2:

Input: grid = [[1,1,1],[1,0,1],[1,1,1]]
Output: 32

Example 3:

Input: grid = [[2,2,2],[2,1,2],[2,2,2]]
Output: 46

 

Constraints:

  • n == grid.length == grid[i].length
  • 1 <= n <= 50
  • 0 <= grid[i][j] <= 50

rephrased.body: You are given an n x n grid representing a landscape of cube towers. Each value grid[i][j] indicates the height of the tower at cell (i, j).  Adjacent towers are glued together. Calculate the total surface area of the resulting 3D shapes, including the bottom faces of each tower.

testcases.explanation: Consider a 2x2 grid with cube heights [1, 2] and [3, 4]. The total surface area is calculated as the sum of the surface area of each individual tower minus the area covered by adjacent towers glued together.
Consider a 3x3 grid with some cube heights being 0. Calculate the total surface area considering the empty space (height 0) as well.
Consider a 3x3 grid where most of the towers have height 2. The tower in the center has height 1. The surface area is calculated as the sum of all exposed surfaces of each cube tower.
